# This will get executed each time the exercise gets initialized load(url("https://github.com/AaronGullickson/combined_stats/blob/master/example_datasets/politics/politics.RData?raw=true")) library(ggplot2) # create a histogram of family income from the politics data ggplot(politics, aes()) # create a histogram of family income from the politics data ggplot(politics, aes(x=income))+ geom_histogram(binwidth=10, color="black", fill="grey")+ labs(x="family income in $1000s")+ theme_bw() ex() %>% { check_function(., "ggplot") %>% check_arg("data") %>% check_equal() check_function(., "aes") %>% { check_arg(., "x") %>% check_equal(eval=FALSE, incorrect_msg="The `x` aesthetic should be the variable `income`.") } check_function(., "geom_histogram") %>% { check_arg(., "binwidth", arg_not_specified_msg="You should try specifying the `binwidth` argument in `geom_histogram`.") } check_function(., "labs", not_called_msg="You should provide labels for your axes with the `labs` command." ) %>% { check_arg(., "x", arg_not_specified_msg="You should label the x-axis") } } success_msg("Great Job!")
